Famous Type 1's (Athletes, Musicians, Everyday Heroes, etc)

Options
  • Mark as New
  • Bookmark
  • Subscribe to Direct Replies to This Post
  • Subscribe to RSS Feed
  • Highlight

‎06-13-2012 07:22 AM

I thought it might be interesting and fun to list some famous Type 1 diabetics who have, so to speak "ridden the tiger" while accomplishing major feats in their fields of endeavor or, are everyday heroes in our lives.  My starting choice is:

 

Jay Cutler, Current Quarterback of The Chicago Bears

 

Type 1A ~ Diagnosed 1967 (age 10)
MDI ~ Levemir & Humalog
Dexcom G4

‎06-13-2012 10:29 AM

I didn't think there were any NBA players who were Type 1 (talk about physical intensity -- I'm a big bball fan) but I was wrong.  Chris Dudley played 886 games

in the NBA for The New Jersey Nets, the Portland Trail Blazers, The New York Knicks, and the Phonix Suns.  6'11" post player and T1 since the age of 16. 

 

Claim to Fame: NBA player DOB: February 22, 1965 Diabetes Type:1

Quote: "If you want to play sports, you can play sports. Don't let diabetes stop you. But, that doesn't mean that you shouldn't take care of your condition."

 

Background:  As a teenager, former NBA player Chris Dudley played on the basketball team for Torrey Pines High School in California. After graduating, he attended Yale University and became a three-time First Team All-Ivy League selection. Dudley finished college with a degree in economics and political science, but dreamed of entering the NBA.  He began playing for the Cleveland Cavaliers in the 1987-1988 NBA season. Due to an immense amount of injuries, Dudley was often traded during his career, and thus played for several NBA teams. The different teams include the New Jersey Nets, the Portland Trail Blazers, The New York Knicks, and the Phoenix Suns.  At 6’ 11”, Chris Dudley was an exceptional defender known for strong rebound and shot-blocking capabilities. His ability to play in 886 games while living with diabetes earned him a lot of respect.  Dudley has taken insulin since 1981 when he was diagnosed with diabetes; he was only sixteen. The disease, however, did not quench his desire to play.  In 1998, Dudley started the Chris Dudley Foundation so he could motivate young people with diabetes to pursue active lifestyles. The Foundation includes sports camps and clinics that teach young teens how to successfully balance sports with diabetes management.  Known for his charitable work, Dudley won the NBA’s J. Walter Kennedy Citizenship Award and USA Today’s Most Caring Athlete Award. Dudley has donated money to help fund Yale’s basketball program, as well as sponsored a class of fourth graders to attend college through the “I Have a Dream Foundation.”  More recently, Dudley has attempted to enter politics. In 2010, he won the Republican nomination for Governor of Oregon, but later lost the November election to a former two-term Oregon governor.

 

Type 1A ~ Diagnosed 1967 (age 10)
MDI ~ Levemir & Humalog
Dexcom G4

‎06-13-2012 10:40 AM

I can't find any current or former U.S. Senators or Representatives with T1.  This can't be right, can it?  No-one in Congress has been a Type 1?  Do you suppose this is part of the slow-roll in funding research???  If it's true, those of you with T1 sons and daughters -- maybe they could make some history.  But again, I don't this can be right -- just need to dig a little deeper.  There has to be at least one.

 

 

Type 1A ~ Diagnosed 1967 (age 10)
MDI ~ Levemir & Humalog
Dexcom G4

‎06-13-2012 11:45 AM

The accomplished television actress Jean Smart comes to mind.  She's been T1 since the age of 13, and was an inspriration to me because she was pregnant a little before I was and I read in a magazine article that she was testing an average of 13x/day while on a set.  This was in the late 80's before pregnancy was as common among T1s as it is today and that amount of testing was highly unusual.  Her 13 became my magic testing number for my own pregnancy -- it just stuck in my head as something that had worked for someone else.  That article made her a role model for me. 

Type 1A ~ Diagnosed 1967 (age 10)
MDI ~ Levemir & Humalog
Dexcom G4

‎06-13-2012 11:49 AM - edited ‎06-13-2012 12:36 PM

I'm going to throw in an Everyday Hero I know.   Our family doctor! 

 

He's been  T1 since age 16 and has been the best influnce on Courtney of how she can manage to have a career and full life even as a T1.   After going to him for 4 years, she's finally opening up to really talk about it with him cause she says she feels comfortable with him to talk about having it.

 

He's my hero

 

 **And I just found these looking for famous/known ppl with T1**

 

Race car driver

 

famous people(s)


Mother of Courtney, Dx'd Type 1 in 2006 at age 14.

Self: Dx'd "Pre"-Diabetic 8/8/14 *and we all know what that means*

‎06-13-2012 05:12 PM - edited ‎06-13-2012 05:16 PM

I posted this on another topic, but Phil Sutherland, Cyclist and founder of Team Type 1. http://www.teamtype1.org/ He was diagnosed at 7 months old and was told he would not live to 25 years old.  He went on to Bicycle on the pro level, author of "Not Dead Yet" and now  Team Type 1 has cyclist, runners and triathletes that are all T1s.  Last I heard they are trying to get into the Tour du France this year.  This is about the only sporting event I watch.

 

Have to add my CDE also.  She is a T1, pumper (was one of the first in the area to go on the OmniPod) and in my first couple of months was definitely my lifeline. 

 

edited Note: one of the recent Diabetes Forecast had a number of athletes highlighted http://forecast.diabetes.org/magazine/features/nba-player-gary-forbes-scores-his-dreams

10/4/2011 Type 1
09/13 Omnipod

Go Red Riders!! - 2014 - Signed up to Ride 62.5 miles (metric century 100K) on June 8th at Tour de Cure in Verona NY (Team Ommegang)

‎06-13-2012 05:40 PM - edited ‎06-13-2012 05:42 PM

there are lots; here's a short list of T1's:

Nick Jonas of the Jonas Brothers band; his song "a little bit longer" is about T1 diabetes;

Bret Michaels of Poison - since he was 6 yo;

Mary Tyler Moore (actress);

Jay Cutler - NFL QB (chicago bears);

 

Some T2's:

Randy Jackson (American Idol et al);

Tommy Lee (Motley Crue drummer, Pam Anderson mate);

BB King (Blues legend)

Halle Berry (actress)

Dick Clark (Bandstand, et al...);

Mikhail Gorbechov (Pres USSR);

 

And some I'm not sure if 1 or 2, but probably 2:

Johnny Cash (country singer)

Elvis Presley (R&R singer... if you need more, you're a martian...)

Arthur Ashe (tennis star)

Ty Cobb (famous baseball player)

Ernest Heminway (author)

Mario Puzo (author)

Anne Rice (author)

 

There's lots more... these are just a few I knew about, and a couple I came across for this post.

 

w.

Wayne T1 May 1966
MDI; 46u Lantus Basal

‎06-13-2012 05:54 PM - edited ‎06-13-2012 05:57 PM

Crystal Bowersox and Elliot Yamin, both of American Idol" fame" have type 1. And then theere's Halle Berry...
Pam

Diagnosed Type 1 at age 16 months, over 45 years now
Minimed pump and cgm since July '09. Metformin (insulin resistance), levothyroxine(thyroid), losartan (BP)
I have traveled cross country, and to Canada, UK, Kenya, Mexico, Jamaica, Equador/Galapagos islands, and lived in Egypt for a year.
